node.text:
over the past month i've received countless emails. messages. and comments. asking me to make 'rupi kaur live' available again.  some of you wanted to rewatch it. some of you missed the premiere. and others wanted to share it with family and friends. i feel so honoured to have such an engaged and supportive community. so i hear you!! and yes!!! we've brought it back! 

'rupi kaur live' is now available to watch on my website for $15 usd. and there's a bonus! each ticket comes with an all new aftershow experience: a filmed sit-down chat where i tell you about the making-of the show & the journey it took to get here. the aftershow includes never-before-seen footage. 

i'm also really proud to share that you can now watch it with closed captions in english. portuguese. and spanish. 
 
the show will only be available for a limited time - so make sure you catch it in the next couple of weeks. thank you for your passion and love! your support means the world to me. 

watch now at rupikaur.com

and a big thank you to @eshaadilnaseem  @kaylaofthewild @briannaglosnek @mother_of_krishna @megansensei , gillian jacobs, mahera malik, and lisa nguyen  for all your kind words 🥰🥰🥰

node.text:
earlier today i was writing about writer mohammedelkurd appearance w/ @aymanm on msnbc to say i’ve never seen an interview on american tv like this. it’s a perspective rarely given space on any popular platform in the west. mohammed el-kurd telling the world his truths as a palestinian living under occupation. amid posting i got a message of mohammed being taken by security forces. thankfully he is okay for now as per his twitter at the time of this posting.

there is an asymmetry of violence and power here. even as the entire world watches you amid appearances on cnn & msnbc describing how your home is being taken away from you—you yourself are at the mercy of an occupying force. this part is not complicated. we see it all across the world. beyond the inevitable both-sidesism arguments to come there is a simple truth—young activists speaking truth being intimidated from their homes by powerful armies. from the illegal occupation and encroachment of land to the raiding of religious sites like al-aqsa mosque during ramadan to the inhumane attacks on civilians to the vast censorship of palestinian accounts by social media giants to the consistent dehumanization of an entire peoples by western media and complicit governments—there is simply no justification for this. 

once again in mohammed el-kurd’s words “do you support the violent dispossession of me and my family?”

over the past few months i’ve lost count of the sheer number of people picked up or intimidated by regimes. it’s always been like this across the world. social media occasionally & somewhat gives us a window to reality. power is brutally asymmetrical. hope dignity and the pursuit of self determination are not. 

#savesheikhjarrah

node.title: #savesheikhjarrah — a perspective rarely given space on western tv

node.text:
what an honour and a joy !!!!!!!! to perform a POEM on late night  @fallontonight ♥️♥️♥️♥️ written for my parents and all the working class immigrant families across the world who inspired this piece. (the entire poem can be read in my previous post)

no better way to celebrate tomorrow’s premiere of ‘rupi kaur live’ than to perform this piece on one of my fav shows 🤗🤗🤗 anddddd for those watching the premiere of #RupiKaurLive tmw, get ready!!!!! this is just a little sneak peek into what you can expect. 

tickets available at rupikaur.com (link in bio) 

director: @nikkiormerod
creative direction & producer: @mahsa.sajadi_
producer: @zsouellette
projection designer: @simcity.3d
music: @ashou_singh
mix/master (music): @taruntspoon & @sharmabeats

node.text:
in celebration of @sikhheritagemonth i spoke with @rapinderkaur5 about how sikhi plays an integral role in my art and creativity. we touched on the immense pain the community has endured globally these past few months: from the ongoing #FarmersProtest to yesterday’s mass shooting in indianapolis. yet we remain in chardikala always. for us, the personal is always political. since we were children, topics like activism, revolution, art, and sacrifice have been regular dinner table conversations. i share a story about where my poetry journey really began (not many know this story!!) and how ‘home body’ and the upcoming premiere of ‘rupi kaur live’ came to life. i felt the need to share this beautiful conversation because sikh resiliency has always been the light that guides so many of us. forever in chardikala.

thank you @rapinderkaur5 for creating such a safe & powerful space for me to share openly <3

node.title: rupi kaur x sikh heritage month

node.text:
i am overjoyed to share that my first poetry special ‘rupi kaur live’ will be premiering on april 30th - for one weekend only - and i can’t wait for you to watch it with me 🥺🥺♥️♥️♥️😭😭😭🤗🤗🤗🤗🤗🤗👏🏽 👏🏽 

#rupikaurlive is years in the making. i was in high school when i performed my first poem. i wasn’t doing very well at the time - the future looked bleak. i think i was willing to try anything to help turn things around and so i ended up at a small open-mic night. i was shaking when my turn came up. but i when heard my voice reverberate across the room and land on 30 pairs of ears—i felt something i'd never felt before: that i was worthy of being listened to. 
 
after that i performed anywhere i could. years later those performances turned into books. which then became sold-out tours.

many of you know me only for the books and the poetry i post on instagram- but the stage is where my poetry comes to life. it’s the best place to experience it. i become the woman of my dreams when i'm up there. it’s where i feel most present. most powerful. it’s safe. it’s mine. it’s where everything bad that’s happened can’t touch me. on that stage i get to talk about heartbreak. loss. abuse. love. sisterhood. self acceptance. healing. everythinggggg. i love laughing with you. crying with you. reading to you. and the way we come alive together. 

rupi kaur live is a love letter to you ♥️ for making my dreams come true. thank you for being the greatest readers in the world. thank you for being on this journey with me. for having my back. for loving and supporting and raising poetry to new heights. 

see you on your tv screens april 30th ♥️🙊💃🏽
tickets available at rupikaur.com (link in bio!) 💁🏽‍♀️ for those around the world who can’t watch the premiere at 9pm EST on april 30th- don’t worry. your ticket is valid for the entire weekend (may 1&2) so you can watch at your convenience.

node.text:
the incredibly powerful  @gisellebuchanan is an afro-caribbean american writer. artist. and workshop facilitator. in this workshop she takes us through two powerful writing exercises

1) in the first exercise we write a poem that includes 9 words given to us by giselle 
2) in the second exercise we write an ode to a mundane everyday object in our home. (this one made me feel really emotional and miss my family.)

learning from other instructors and facilitators is so important and vital for growth. everyone has their own writing practices and the more we try new processes the deeper our practice becomes. 

thank you @gisellebuchanan for providing us a place and space to heal and time travel deeper into our lives.

node.text: you alllll need to hear this poem. i can’t stop listening to the aching and beautiful words of @mrjamespoetry 🥺♥️ through this visual poem @mrjamespoetry asks the 3 louisville police officers responsible for the murder of #breonnataylor a series of questions. my heart aches. on march 13 2021 it will be one year since breonna’s death. her and her loved ones still haven’t received justice. watch and share to honour her life. thank you to @ava for commissioning this project- seriouslyyyy how do you always knock it out of the park every damn time 😩♥️🙏🏽

node.text: a conversation with @ch_mandeep.punia and @committeetoprotectjournalists about the attack on journalists in India. mandeep was abducted by police from the farmers protest site on jan 30th. he was tortured and abused for reporting his findings. he is now out on bail, but this is only the beginning of a long and awful battle for him. Many journalists like him have been sitting inside India’s jails for reporting truth for months and even years now. in this conversation we talk about what happened to mandeep- his insights on the farmers protest- and what this all means for press freedom. @aliyazeba shares with us what we can do to support those under attack right now. i encourage everyone to follow @committeetoprotectjournalists to learn more and take action #freethepress #farmersprotest

node.text:
nodeep is a dalit woman. she is a trade union activist rallying for labourers rights. 

on january 12th haryana police abducted nodeep kaur from her tent at the #farmersprotest. for the last 19 days she’s been tortured and sexually assaulted in police custody. we have no information on her condition.

this is what women (especially dalit women) endure when they raise their voice against the indian state. these monsters think they can beat women “back into their place” but our bodies are not for them to abuse and discard. nodeep’s case is emblematic of both the treatment of dalit activists and the custodial violence against women by indian security forces. 

going back thousands of years- violence against women is one of the largest epidemics in human history. one in three women worldwide endures physical or sexual violence. we will rally and fight until #nodeepkaur is free. and then we will continue fighting for every person subjected to similar assaults. #releasenodeepkaur

if you’d like to help: sharing nodeep’s story and bringing awareness to the atrocities faced by minorities in india will be a huge support. even just sharing a story or a post helps being awareness. you can also call and write to media outlets. my friends in media tell me that the indian government is extremely sensitive to criticism (of course since they have so many human rights abuses to hide). this might be why intl media has failed to cover what’s been happening. we demand media outlets to cover nodeep’s story. and cover the #farmersprotest and look into abuses against journalists. when press freedom is silenced- democracy dies. so far editorial boards at ALL major news outlets have been silent while the largest protest in the world is underway. hundreds of protestors have gone missing- most likely picked up by police and their goons. 

i understand the issue is complex & thus people are afraid to speak and report on it. media outlets: please reach out in dms if you have qs. i can connect you w organizers on the ground so you can report with nuance.

video by @saurabh_bambaiya an independent journalist who is producing great work. view their work on yt at opiafilms.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by rupi on September 14, 2021 tagging @jagmeetsingh. May be an image of 2 people, people standing and indoor.

node.text: @jagmeetsingh makes people feel seen. i met him over a decade ago when i first began performing poetry and became a community organizer. i remember how difficult it was for me to be in this new space where no one knew me. i constantly felt invisible. but jagmeet walked right up to me back then and welcomed me with open arms. he made me feel seen. cause he truly believes we all deserve to be. that is his superpower. jagmeet isn’t interested in the shiniest person in the room. he’s interested in everybody. he’s interested in the people standing at the back of a room all by themselves. the ones who have a lot to say - but are too afraid to say it. or don’t have the platform to say it. whether you’re the person in the fancy suit running the show. or you’re the person taking out the garbage after a long night of work. jagmeet will see you. no matter what colour. age. gender. or class. i have been lucky enough to have his mentorship since that time. and i often get asked: how was jagmeet before he got into politics? was he always this engaged and interested in the people? and i’m so proud to tell them: yes. he has been this way for as long as i can remember. and he’s done that for a whole generation. he encouraged so many of us to pursue our dreams. to forever trust in ourselves. in the work. to stay in chardikala. and think of how we impact the worlds around us. jagmeet doesn’t know how to be anything other than real. time has passed but his politics haven’t wavered. they have further cemented. and that is why it gives me so much joy to endorse my brother jagmeet singh as canada’s next prime minister. jagmeet - when you approached me that day ten years ago. at a time when most people wrote me off as a nobody. you came over to show me i belonged. that we are all connected. that when one rises - we all rise. when one suffers - we all suffer. i knew from that day you were going to change the world.

this first photo in the slide was taken the day i first met the entire ‘rupi kaur live’ crew (director. set designer. composer. and about 2 dozen others) i was so amped i made everyone this t-shirt to set the tone for the journey we were about to embark on 😂 honestly i felt ready to tear shit down and i wasn’t afraid to say it 💅🏽

the second photo was taken the day we shot the special. so beautiful to see things come full circle🤗♥️

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by rupi on September 05, 2021 tagging @leleroybennett. May be an image of flower.

node.text:
one of the most magical parts of making rupi kaur live was working with the extraordinary @leleroybennett on the set and lighting design. 

when my producer kimmie kim said she was going to approach @leleroybennett to ask him to be our set and lighting designer-i wanted to stop her. leroy had worked on sets for beyonce, ariana, lady gaga and many more. he was prince’s lighting designer for much of his career. i wanted to tell kimmie: “let’s save me the embarrassment of being rejected by such a legend and find someone who’ll actually say yes to little ol’ me” 😂

kimmie called a week later and said “leroy’s in” and i almost fainted. played it cool but screamed when i hung up😩😩😩😩

ngl, i was so nervous meeting him. but the moment we got to work it was seamless. it was like he was in my head! leroy wanted to preserve my original set design but amplify it to another level. prior to the filming of ‘rupi kaur live’, the set design i’d tour with was mostly bare. it was just me standing in front of a microphone, with a small halo of rose petals around me (barely 2 meters wide). behind me, there would be a projection playing on a rectangle screen. you can see what this set looked like in the last two slides...super bare bones, right?! 

what happened next was magical. leroy built a large platform for me to stand on. built dozens of giant petals and surrounded me with them. he even had some spilling over the edge of the stage. we didn’t want any hard edges visible on stage so leroy replaced the rectangular projection with a circular one. 

@leleroybennett thank you for believing in me. thank you for helping me build the most beautiful universe for the big screen. this poetry special is the first of its kind to hit a major streaming platform, i’m so happy people get to witness the stage you built on amazon prime. what a ride we went on to make this happen ♥️you helped bring this dream to life in a way i couldn’t have imagined♥️

node.text:
page 60 from home body ♥️📖 

wrote this at a time when i was exploring why over time we stop seeing the shine in what belongs to us. or why we don’t appreciate some relationships as much as we should. or share as much gratitude as we could. once it’s ours- and it becomes a normal integrated part of our life, maybe it doesn’t feel as “special” anymore. in conclusion- the human brain is complicated and deeply annoying :)

node.text: me seeing RUPI KAUR LIVE on @primevideoca for the first time 😭😭😭😭😭😭😭😭😭 honestly been reloading this page over and over all week. never in a million years did i even dream this was even possible. when i first started performing spoken word poetry in high school i just knew i had to keep coming back to the stage and so that’s what i did. hahah high school me would’ve fallen onto the floor and gone to the afterlife if she knew a poetry special would end up on a major streaming platform. seeing this screen finally makes it real 😂😂 omg it finallllllly feels fkn real and i’m so hype !!!!!!

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by rupi on September 01, 2021. May be a black-and-white image of text that says 'men like him are experts at smelling out girls like me the invisible ones who believe they must be ugly because their fathers didn' love them he said my name and had never heard my name dance off man' lips before give little attention to someone who' never had any and they' be slipping and falling all over the place unable to contain the joy of being wanted the relief of being discovered he groomed me into thinking i couldn survive without him this how men like him trap girls like me predator rupi kaur'.

node.text:
TRIGGER WARNING: abuse 

grooming is something that we don’t often talk about. most people don’t know what it is. some don’t believe it’s real. i wrote this poem because i wanted to share how it is to be a vulnerable child and have someone older prey on you. so often people turn to the child expecting adult behaviour from them. they ask the child: “didn’t you know what you were doing....what they were doing?” , “if it hurt didn’t you know to leave?” and so on and on and the answer is no. a child’s mind is not able to fully process the trauma and take agency in these situations. a child’s brain is not a fully developed adult brain. it is vulnerable. impressionable. this poem lives on page 54 of home body 🌱

node.text:
home body hardcover is here !!! to celebrate one year since home body’s birth i am excited to share this clothbound edition with a foreword written by yours truly ♥️ and some new poems ♥️

for everyone who’s been asking for a keepsake edition that’ll age like fine wine so you can pass it on to your children and your children's children 😛😛😛 here it is. 

i designed this cover to sit beautifully next to my other hardcovers. wrapped in a forest green linen and finished with a copper foil stamp for the drawing and title. 

thank you for reading. sharing. and loving home body over the past year. i hope this edition holds a special place on your bookshelves. 

pre-order now everywhere books are sold and have it in your hands on november 16th.

visit website for details😘
